name: Go
description: Go is a statically typed, compiled, concurrent programming language inspired by C syntax, but with memory safety and garbage collection. It was developed by Google and its initial designers were Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, and Ken Thompson.

frameworks.name: Gin
frameworks.description: A fast, minimalistic HTTP web framework for Go that offers great performance and a simple API for building web services and microservices.

frameworks.name: Echo
frameworks.description: A high-performance, extensible web framework for Go that makes it easy to build robust and scalable web applications.

frameworks.name: Beego
frameworks.description: A full-featured and high-performance framework for Go, inspired by Django and Python, which includes features like ORM, auto-compilation, and configuration API.

frameworks.name: Revel
frameworks.description: A high-level web framework for Go that promotes rapid development with a clean project structure and a focus on developer productivity.

frameworks.name: Fiber
frameworks.description: Inspired by Express.js, Fiber is a very fast and lightweight web framework for Go, designed to ease the development of web applications.

frameworks.name: Mux
frameworks.description: An HTTP router for Go that offers pattern-based routing and middleware, ideal for creating RESTful APIs.

frameworks.name: Buffalo
frameworks.description: A complete ecosystem for building web applications in Go, which includes generators, front-end support, and development tools.

frameworks.name: Chi
frameworks.description: A lightweight and fast HTTP router for Go that enables creating RESTful APIs and handling middleware efficiently.

frameworks.name: Iris
frameworks.description: A fast, efficient web framework for Go with many features, including support for WebSockets and HTTP/2.

frameworks.name: Martini
frameworks.description: A minimalistic web framework for Go that offers a simple and easy-to-use API, ideal for creating microservices and lightweight web applications.
